context: The word 'tapsid' is the past tense (second person singular) of the Estonian verb 'tapma'. It means 'to kill', 'to eliminate', or 'to finish off'. The verb can be used literally for killing living beings, but also metaphorically for completing tasks or eliminating problems. In the given examples: 1) Tapsin valesüüdistuse - I eliminated a false accusation; 2) Ta tapsis oma eesmärki - He killed his goal/objective (metaphorically); 3) Me tapsime selle ülesande ära - We finished off that task.
